p: In the COVID-19 pandemic, the U.S. health care system may face another huge challenge due to shortage of PPE, which are routinely used by health care providers to protect themselves from infectious conditions and toxic substances. The fundamental goal is to avoid elective procedures in order to conserve precious resources like PPE and hospital beds and also minimize unnecessary exposure to COVID-19. A practical guide from a New York City Hospital Network describes an approach used to overcome these challenges due to the surge of COVID-19 activity in New York by ramping downÂ and restructuring of the electrophysiology services ( 74).
